bow: guilt about going back to work going back to work in about month my daughter will be just over months old she will be staying with my mom which is great financial relief but can help but feel guilty work hour days hours plus lunch and wont be getting home until 6:30 7pm one day week the rest of the week ll get home at 5:30 just can help but feel sad how did do you cope how many hours do you guys work was thinking about asking to cut down on hours but just got promotion before leaving for maternity leave and my hours coincide with the promotion you are alone think most working moms feel guilty for being away from their kiddo how do cope do just feel guilty and get my butt to work do keep strict boundaries between work and home and never bring work home rarely go in early or stay late work full time as in house counsel for large corporation about nights every week not even home to see dd before my husband puts her to bed it is sad but it is sacrifice lot of people have to make you are supporting your baby and your family and in the long run that is what matters most your baby will be fine and will grow up to admire you as hard working mom definitely keep boundaries between work and home as already stated remind yourself that you are there to earn living so that you can continue to provide for your child that always helps me have your mom send you lots of pictures while you re gone some days you may not want this if you miss them too much but it always makes me feel better to see my little guy having fun its okay to be sad was gutted over leaving my little guy behind to go to work cried on my first day back that totally normal response just remember at the end of the day you re doing it for them felt this pain too went back to work from home when my son was weeks old and back into the office at weeks was commuting an hour for work so there were some days would drop him off at 6:45am and not pick him up until nearly 7:00 pm it will be hard at first and there no easy way to get over it it ll just take time although it was greater burden on me would often get up with him throughout the night wake up extra early to spend time with him in the morning and asked our sitter for photos videos during the day which really helped me feel like was there even when was and while yes it broke my heart to be away from him for 40+ hours week it really made the time that we were together much more special still have guilt some days about working full time but it does get much easier after while work 80 schedule so every other week have day weekend social worker and it not 100 desk job it mix of field work and desk work just moved to be closer to my parents and have more space for me and the baby so my commute is super long now out of the house from about in some ways it really sucks lot feel like miss out on lot my in laws and my parents watch my son during the day and my in laws take my son out to do fun things all the time get pictures but ve never been able to take him to do fun things besides actually working and commuting there are so many things at home that have to do to keep things running and safe and clean there is no one else to do it it just me tbh do feel any guilt about being gone during the day my day job is frankly easier than watching my kid my commute is relaxing ride the ferry and my bike do feel butt ton of guilt about having to choose chores and errands over like going to the zoo or the beach or just laying on the floor playing with my kid it sucked then it still sucks now lucky she did have to go to daycare till she was months because her dad stayed at home with her so those months it was easier because knew she was in good hands she been in actual daycare for months now and still feel bad leaving her and feel like horrible mom it helps that she likes daycare but the though of not being there and watching her grow up still hurts it hard really hard still feel guilty my oldest is but go to work go home for me it got better when they were school age because they like school and after care and can tell me about the fun things they do my hours are long attorney and at *best* 530 plus 60 90 minutes of commuting for four years in there was plus tons of nights and travel my husband hours are shorter than mine 730 months year so he can do pick up but those months his are longer are really awful ultimately had to move on from much higher paying job to get one where can do 530 have fewer responsibilities lower pay less opportunity for advancement and high profile work but could handle the stress and guilt of 60 hour work weeks out source instant cart housekeeper when can afford it amazon then the time save on that is with my kids doing stuff they like otherwise my whole off time would be chores admittedly take no awake kid time for me many weeks but that my choice would advise that do my nails and watch bad tv and reddit after they go to bed and that works for now good luck hope it eases for you soon removed it was difficult at first went back at about the he week mark and though it was kinda rough it was nice to be back with people enjoyed and adult time again otherwise was starting to feel antsy stir crazy my husband has been the stay at home since that simply not what did well at work in childcare so there isn too much of bringing work home would have to stay late though if the children don already crying thinking about it and it month away definitely asking my mom for pictures and videos hard working momma hope it doesn take me too long to get over it so attached to her she just so cute biggest thing my husband learned was to put away the phone and be present since you re in childcare you probably already know that focus on quality time and know while you may feel guilty your kid will feel loved by you so grateful to have my husband although have to remind him or ask him to do chores do have help around the house it is really hard taking care of newborn and who knows maybe ll like going back to work but right now it just feels like ll be letting my baby down hope you at least get some time during the weekends to do fun stuff part of me wishes could be stay at home mom my son is 10 months old and he really happy guy but also realize that it is in the cards for us financially and need outside stimulation job to organize myself if stayed home nothing would get done and pretty much do that but since there only so much to do with newborn admittedly do chores or browse reddit while she content in the swing for few minutes thanks for responding am looking forward to taking it slow my job isn too physically demanding but mentality demanding thanks for your response thank you for your response and yes the phone thing is so important to remember for all parents don for granted they grow up fast months old this is insane this is absolute cruelty on the part of your government assuming usa in canada we have paid maternity leave up to 18 months and that still doesn feel like enough sometimes can imagine leaving newborn and heading back to work am so sorry that you re put in this position against your wishes took family sociology class in college that overall was pretty lame but one good takeaway had was from book about qualitative study interviewing kids and then following up with them as adults the kids who seemed to have the best outcomes and best relationships with their parents pretty universally reported that they knew their moms were happy with whatever choice they made for example the children of moms who stayed home with them but clearly resented it or missed their professional lives were affected by her unhappiness whereas kid could tell if his mom was satisfied by her work and that rubbed off positively on him basically making the best choice for yourself really is the best choice for your kid too my job doesn even have paid leave using up all my saved vacation and sick time plus taking extra time unpaid yes in the and yes it sucks glad you get lots of time to spend with your little one so lucky my job doesn offer paid maternity leave using up all my vacation and sick time definitely taking every second for granted wish
